title: Echoes Under the Archon's Gaze
setting_narration: The sun dips low, casting long, golden shadows across the Plaza of the Seven. A gentle, cool breeze rustles through the trees, carrying the faint scent of cecilias. The towering Statue of the Seven stands sentinel, its benevolent gaze falling upon two figures deep in conversation, their usual solemnity deepened by the quiet evening.

segments.text: Jean stands by the statue's base, her eyes tracing the intricate carvings, a wistful expression on her face. Diluc leans against a nearby tree, arms crossed, his gaze distant.

segments.speaker: Jean
segments.line: Sometimes, when the city quiets down like this, and the world seems to hold its breath... I can't help but wonder.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Wonder about what, Acting Grand Master? The ever-present duties that await?

segments.speaker: Jean
segments.line: No, not always. Sometimes... I wonder about the paths not taken. The lives we might have lived, had our hearts followed a different call.

segments.text: Diluc shifts his weight, his eyes briefly flicking towards Jean, then back to the horizon where the sun was almost gone.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Regret is a luxury, or perhaps a burden, best left buried. The past is fixed; our focus must remain on the present, and the threats yet to come.

segments.speaker: Jean
segments.expression_action: (looking at the statue, then back at Diluc)
segments.line: Even so, there are echoes. Memories of people who once held a different kind of importance in our lives. A warmth that lingers, even if the flame has long since died.

segments.text: A comfortable silence settles between them, punctuated only by the gentle evening breeze. Diluc closes his eyes for a moment, a rare, almost imperceptible softening in his expression.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Love, like fine wine, can leave a bitter aftertaste if the vintage wasn't meant to last. Or if one simply wasn't prepared for its full impact.

segments.speaker: Jean
segments.line: Indeed. But even the bitter moments teach us something. Perhaps to cherish what we have, or to understand the depth of our own convictions... and sacrifices.

segments.text: Jean glances at Diluc, a silent, mutual understanding passing between them â€“ two souls burdened by their roles and their pasts, finding a rare moment of shared reflection under the watchful eye of the Anemo Archon.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.expression_action: (straightening up, returning to his usual demeanor)
segments.line: It seems our candid conversation has run its course. The city will require our attention soon enough. Good night, Acting Grand Master.

segments.speaker: Jean
segments.line: Good night, Master Diluc. Thank you... for the talk.

segments.text: As the last sliver of sun dipped below the horizon, plunging the plaza into twilight, they both turned and walked away in separate directions, leaving the echoes of their pasts to mingle with the evening air.
